item.title: Damaged Electrical Cabinet - Electrical Feeder Pillar Badly Damaged with Cabling Spilling Out of It, 28th December
item.description:
Badly damaged metal Electrical Feeder Pillar with cover missing, DNO supply is also exposed and there is multiple cables (which could be live?) spilling out of the Feeder Pillar. The cables are laying there, with bare ends and are all exposed, on the ground and within easy reach for children and animals etc., also being exposed to the damp/wet conditions. This Electrical Feeder Pillar is located behind the relevant Bus Stop which is in front of it (Erith Town Centre / Cross Street). Stop Code is Stop G at this location and it is located, up against the red brick wall/rear of the Celestial Church of Christ. I'm not sure if this piece of equipment's responsibility falls on the DNO (UK Power Networks in this situation), the local council or TfL etc. but this being in the condition that it is, I would have to assume that this damaged piece of equipment poses an immediate danger to the public and animals. Some quick photos where the damaged metal electrical box can be seen, have been supplied along with this report. The What3Words location of the damaged electrical box is: ///react.train.roof.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cross Street, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog waste bin on lamppost outside 75 Camberwell Grove was broken and has now been removed and an old general litter bin has been put in its place. This is being used for dog faeces and is mot hygienic. Dog walkers are also putting nahs of poo in residents bins., 28th December
item.description:
Dog bin on lamppost outside 75 Camberwell Grove has been taken away and not replaced. Dog poo is being put in general bin nearby and also in bins of residents. It is important to have a special dog poo bin here as it is en-route to a heavily used dog walking park.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Camberwell Grove, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheelie bins left on street for more then 4 months., 28th December
item.description:
The 2 wheelie bins for No4 Lassa Road have been left outside the house on the street since July 2025. The bins are permanently left on the street all week and not put away. They are an obstruction to pedestrians and a nuisance. They are also moved along and onto the pavement by members of the public one thier way home late at night. The attached photo is from August.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lassa Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadsweeping, 28th December
item.description:
In spite of previous reporting, the huge amount of fallen leaves--much of it now rotting--still remain. Now would be an optimal time to do roadsweeping, as there are far fewer parked cars which make it extremely difficult to roadsweep. The huge amount of leaves have been here for many weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81, Camberwell Grove, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge dog poo outside 103, 28th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clifden Road, Hackney, London
